description: Career Opportunities with Black Rifle Coffee Company Black Rifle Coffee Company is disrupting the coffee market as a premium, small-batch, roast-to-order, veteran-owned business. We have a love for coffee, dogs, the outdoors, America, and most importantly, our customers! We are more than a product and more than a company; we are a culture. A culture full of motivated people who roll up their sleeves and get the job done with integrity, love, innovation, and radical transparency. Join us as we take action on our commitment to provide quality coffee and give back to the veteran and first responder communities and those who support it.  THE ROLE  We are looking to add a Sr. Events Manager to be responsible for the development, execution, and management of cross-functional projects within the BRCC Events team. This position will be operational and strategic as you coordinate with resources throughout the organization. Some responsibilities include ensuring that projects progress on schedule and according to budget while managing communication across teams and be expected to work both independently and collaboratively based on the nature of each project. YOUR TASK Execute national and regional events with operational and logistical excellence using industry standard knowledge and applying innovation. Collaborate with Marketing to develop and execute the demand generation strategy to drive event attendance and engagement and generate marketing qualified leads. Execute campaign tactics that obtain new marketing coffee club subscriptions, generate new partner opportunities, accelerate RTD opportunities, and deepen / nurture our existing customer relationships. Manage all aspects of Event marketing programs, including content and run-of-show development, experience and visual design, vendors, communications, promotions, and production. Direct booth and demo equipment installation and dismantle. Evaluate and report on event ROI, including lead tracking, surveys, post-event tracking, wrap reports, and recommendations for future events. Stay current on best practice event design and activation trends to drive business results. Track, process and reconcile event marketing invoices. Will be required to perform other duties as requested, directed or assigned. Travel 50% Your Experience  High School Diploma, Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field preferred     3+ years of demonstrated experience in organizing and managing events     Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels and with different audiences     Experience to “manage up” when necessary to ensure that all deadlines are being met and that the team stays on track to hit all deliverables     Appreciates a “hands on” approach to supporting a C-suite executive / team, with exceptional follow-through     Veteran or a strong connection to the US Military is a PLUS    Your Benefits  Competitive Pay     401k with company match on Day 1     Company-paid life insurance + supplemental options     Short and Long-Term disability options/coverage     Extensive EAP program with legal coverage     Pro-deal discounts with corporate partners in outdoor equipment, clothing, etc.     Dog friendly and irreverently humorous work environment     American values-based culture built on freedom, integrity, accountability, respect, love, and commitment to serve those who have served.    BRCC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, sex, race, color, religion, national origin, genetics, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other protected characteristic required by applicable law. All selected candidates will be required to submit to a pre-employment background check.
title: Event Manager
